H0.text: Who was the first Roman Emperor to sport a beard. Augustus

H1.text: Who was the first Roman Emperor to sport a beard. Trajan

H2.text: Who was the first Roman Emperor to sport a beard. Vespasian

H3.text: Who was the first Roman Emperor to sport a beard. Hadrian

A4.text: All Roman emperors until Trajan, except Nero who occasionally wore sideburns, were depicted clean-shaven, according to the fashion introduced among the Romans by Scipio Africanus (236 â€“ 183 BC)

A5.text: This Imperial fashion was changed by Trajan's successor Hadrian who made beards fashionable for emperors
